result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit a DNA sample. Pay all costs and surcharges at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12-01-15 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
STRAIGHT TIME; Sentence STAYED until 08-18-15 by 5pm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge , Br *, for review.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served; STRAIGHT TIME; sentenc stayed until August 18, 2015 by 5:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing December 1, 2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed telephone contact; no action taken.

Defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs to conduct additional investigation.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Joshua Nigel Pinnock in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
